name: Locate the Spanish Word Quiz | Languages | 10 Questions

questions.text: Steve loved his video games much more than he did playing OUTDOORS. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "outdoors"?
questions.explanation:
Al aire libre.

	The Spanish translation of the sentence is: Steve amaba a sus juegos de video mucho más de lo que se juega al aire libre.   "Dentro" is indoors."Arriba" is upstairs."Abajo" is downstairs.

questions.text: Bob accepted the fact that his daughter Louise was INSANE. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "insane"?
questions.explanation:
Demente.

	The Spanish translation is: Bob aceptó el hecho de que su hija Louise era una "demente".  "Mal" is evil."Brilliante" is brilliant."Pensativo" is thoughtful.

questions.text: "Hannibal" was CANCELLED after season three for poor ratings. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "cancelled"?
questions.explanation:
Cancelado.

	The Spanish translation is: "Hannibal" fue "cancelada" después de la temporada tres de malas calificaciones.   "Abierto" is open."Renovado" is renewed."Cerrado" is closed.

questions.text: Leroy didn't understand the new COMPUTER programs installed on his computer. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "computer"?
questions.explanation:
La computadora.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is: Leroy no entendía los nuevos programas de computadora instalados en su "computadora".  "El hogar" is Spanish for home."El brazo" is Spanish for arm."El puerto" is Spanish for door.

questions.text: Jason wanted TO WRITE Sam a letter, but Elizabeth wouldn't let him. What is the Spanish equivalent of the phrase "to write"?
questions.explanation:
Escribir.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is: Jason quería a Sam a "escribir" una carta, pero Elizabeth no le dejaba.  "Cantar" is to sing."Comer" is to eat."Establacer" is to lay down.

questions.text: Mike and Molly wanted to get PREGNANT, but they were having a hard time conceiving. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "pregnant"?
questions.explanation:
Embarazada.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is: Mike y Molly querían conseguir "embarazado", pero ellos estaban teniendo un tiempo difícil concebir.  "Tienda" is Spanish for store."La Sala" is Spanish for living room."Manta" is Spanish for blanket.

questions.text: Frankie decided she couldn't take any more from her boss and QUIT her job at the car dealership. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "quit"?
questions.explanation:
Renunció.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is: Frankie decidió que no podía aguantar más de su jefe y "renunció" a su trabajo en el concesionario de coches.  "Comenzar" means begin."Frente" means front."Espalda" means back.

questions.text: Tyler wanted to go to the UNIVERSITY in California, but his parents wanted him to stay in-state. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "university"?
questions.explanation:
Universidad.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is: Tyler quería ir a la "universidad" en California, pero sus padres le quería quedarse en el estado.  "Cama" means bed."Tienda" means store."Escuela secundiara" means high school.

questions.text: How was Amy TO KNOW that the rest of her life was supposed to be spent with Sheldon? What is the Spanish equivalent of the phrase "to know"?
questions.explanation:
Saber.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is: ¿Cómo fue Amy "saber" que se suponía que el resto de su vida para ser gastado con Sheldon? "Comer" means to eat."Cantar" means to sing."Visitar" means to visit.

questions.text: Vanessa wanted Mike to say hello to their new NEIGHBOR before he went to work. What is the Spanish equivalent of the word "neighbor"?
questions.explanation:
El vecino.

	The Spanish translation of this sentence is : Vanessa quería Mike para saludar a su nuevo "vecino" antes de ir a trabajar. "El primo" is Spanish for cousin."El tío" is Spanish for uncle."El amigo" is Spanish for friend.
